title: The Price

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Let me get this straight. Everyone in Daein will die if you disobey the senate?

intro.speaker: Tauroneo
intro.line: What a heavy burden... It cannot be!

intro.speaker: Almedha
intro.line: Show Mother the mark of your pact.

intro.speaker: Almedha
intro.line: It's true... This is the mark of a blood pact. My son has been deceived!

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Oh, give it up! You expect us to buy that ghost story? It's just something to scare little kings into eating their vegetables! Before you go shining Begnion's boots, get some proof of the senate's claims!

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: We've done enough here. Micaiah, let's go. We'll let them find out if that story is real or not.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: It's all true, Sothe.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: What?

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: King Pelleas and Queen Almedha are telling us the truth. It's hard to believe, but I can see it... My power hasn't gone away. It was just weakened from exhaustion. This is all so horrible... Now Daein can never be free from the senate's leash.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Even if it's true, Micaiah, that doesn't mean you have to go to war again. We could leave Daein...

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: But without me, who would hold our forces together? Leaving the army would be the same as abandoning the people of Daein. I won't do it.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: But...

intro.speaker: Pelleas
intro.line: I'm sorry, everyone.. I'm so sorry... I-I-I didn't know...

intro.speaker: Tauroneo
intro.line: King Pelleas... What then do you propose we do?

intro.speaker: Pelleas
intro.line: Why, obey the empire, of course. We have no other choice in the matter. As long as I follow the senate's orders, no one will die because of me.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: No, I can't accept that! We have finally wrested our country back from the occupation forces... I'd rather be dead than have to bend to the will of the empire. What are we, dogs?!

intro.speaker: Tauroneo
intro.line: And now that Begnion is ordering Daein troops into battle, we are treated as disposable pawns. Many Daein citizens will die of this pact, whether we obey it or not.

intro.speaker: Pelleas
intro.line: It would appear that I have been crowned king during the last days of Daein. Follow or fight...the result is the same. We will be destroyed.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: With all due respect, Your Majesty, we can't give up!

intro.speaker: Pelleas
intro.line: What?

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: You heard me. The only way to really be doomed is to give up.

intro.speaker: Pelleas
intro.line: Micaiah, there's no way out of a blood pact. None! What do you suggest we do?

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Look for a way out. I know Duke Lekain says the pact can't be broken, but of course he'd say that! King Pelleas, you have the resources of an entire country to draw on, and the best of reasons to do so. Check the royal library! Check the archives! Somewhere, I'm sure you'll find...something.

intro.speaker: Pelleas
intro.line: Micaiah, forgive me. I was so overwhelmed that I let myself give in to despair. But you're absolutely right. We can't give up just yet. We have people to save!

intro.speaker: Tauroneo
intro.line: Unfortunately, we don't have much time. Begnion will not put off triggering the blood pact until after we've found a way to break it.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: We can make time. If we take on the empress and the laguz forces, it'll look as if we're obeying the senate. In the meantime, you can research the pact.

intro.speaker: Pelleas
intro.line: All right. I'll start immediately. Just give me as much time as you can...

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Of course. We'll do our best to hold them back...whatever it takes.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: It looks as if the apostle's forces are using this road to avoid a head-on confrontation. I guess we were right in assuming that they don't necessarily want to fight. Micaiah, are you still set on this?

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Are the rocks ready?

intro.speaker: Tauroneo
intro.line: Yes. They're in position.

intro.speaker: Daein
intro.line: General Maiel's forces have encountered General Ike's laguz forces. The battle has begun! The decoy operation succeeded. The apostle and her Holy Guards are heading this way.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: All forces, get in position! Our target is the apostle. We will attack her while General Ike is distracted. If we let her through, her army will cross into Begnion. That will surely anger the senate, and the senate will move to destroy Daein. We must fight with everything we have so that Daein may live on!

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: But, Micaiah... Is this really necessary? Can't we avoid all of this fighting and somehow pretend to obey the senate?

intro.speaker: Tauroneo
intro.line: Micaiah, it was you more than anyone else who used to hate plans like this...

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: The apostle's army has incredible numbers. We wouldn't stand a chance taking them head-on. They would march right through us. We need to give Pelleas more time, but if we hold back, the senate will know we're up to something. For now...let's just try to draw this out a bit and stop the apostle's army.

intro.speaker: Tauroneo
intro.line: Lady Micaiah. Your strength moves me. I shall not falter.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Micaiah... All right. Let's do it. Let's do it for our friends--and for our country.

intro.speaker: Daein
intro.line: We have visual confirmation on the Holy Guards! They're heading this way!

flashback.speaker: Pelleas
flashback.line: What could be so urgent that the empire's messenger would pay a visit at this hour? Has something happened?

flashback.speaker: Messenger
flashback.line: King Pelleas... Please prepare to receive Vice-Minister Lekain.

flashback.speaker: Pelleas
flashback.line: What?!

flashback.speaker: Lekain
flashback.line: How do you do, King Pelleas?

flashback.speaker: Pelleas
flashback.line: H-how did you get here?!

flashback.speaker: Lekain
flashback.line: Our empire's magical research has made leaps and bounds. This rewarp staff is our latest invention. With this staff, one can get to any desired destination instantly. Isn't that just wonderful? Before this lovely little item, we used that ghastly warp powder. It worked well enough, but would completely exhaust whoever used it. What's the use of someone traveling anywhere they wish if they're too exhausted to do anything afterward? It'd take a very strong soldier to withstand the powder's side effects. The rewrap staff solves that problem.

flashback.speaker: Messenger
flashback.line: Vice-Minister...

flashback.speaker: Lekain
flashback.line: Ah, now I've said too much. I just can't help myself. I love innovation so.

flashback.speaker: Pelleas
flashback.line: Um... If I may, what is the purpose of your visit?

flashback.speaker: Lekain
flashback.line: Oh, yes. No time for idle chatter. We have a favor to ask of you, Your Majesty. As you are no doubt aware, the false apostle has raised an army of sub-humans to reclaim her throne. We require the use of the Daein army to wipe out this upstart "Laguz Alliance." Would you be so kind?

flashback.speaker: Pelleas
flashback.line: I... I'm afraid I cannot deploy my army on Begnion's behalf. My country cannot continue to rebuild while fighting a war. Please understand.

flashback.speaker: Lekain
flashback.line: Ah, so you reject our request? Then I've no choice but to watch you and your people perish slowly.

flashback.speaker: Pelleas
flashback.line: What?! You came here to make threats?

flashback.speaker: Lekain
flashback.line: The terms of our pact are quite clear in this document.

flashback.speaker: Pelleas
flashback.line: That's the treaty I signed on the day of my coronation. I don't see how this pertains to--

flashback.speaker: Lekain
flashback.line: All will be made clear, young Pelleas. Yes, this is the same document. You, my naïve young king, signed it believing it was an oath of reparation from Begnion. Sadly for you, however...

flashback.speaker: Pelleas
flashback.line: What are you telling me?

flashback.speaker: Lekain
flashback.line: In truth, this wonderful scrap of parchment is a blood pact. Once you sign the paper in blood, you can never break the terms of the pact!

flashback.speaker: Pelleas
flashback.line: A blood pact? But Izuka said he saw no problems with the terms of the treaty... No! Izuka? No, how could he...

flashback.speaker: Lekain
flashback.line: That's right. Izuka is one of us. He found the perfect king who would execute the senate's will.

flashback.speaker: Pelleas
flashback.line: I can't believe it! I won't!

flashback.speaker: Lekain
flashback.line: You'd better start believing it. You've at least heard stories of the forbidden "blood pact," haven't you? It's a marvelous tool used by the wise to control the foolish. A ruler agreeing to the pact is bound to it...absolutely. Once sworn, the pact will punish any transgression against its terms with the complete destruction of his country.

flashback.speaker: Pelleas
flashback.line: You...you can't be serious. That's impossible!

flashback.speaker: Lekain
flashback.line: Calm yourself, young king, and listen. I'll tell you an interesting story. Long ago, a foolhardy king signed a blood pact with the empire to take back his lost kingdom. In exchange for his country, he vowed complete obedience. He soon broke the terms of the pact and began to disobey the empire. Presumably he didn't understand the power of the oath he'd sworn... Would you like to hear what happened after he defied the empire's will?

flashback.speaker: Pelleas
flashback.line: ...What?

flashback.speaker: Lekain
flashback.line: It was quite tragic. One man died on the first day. He was only a peasant, so no one really noticed. Two more died on the second day. Three more on the third day. I think you can see where this is going. The wave of mysterious deaths spread across the kingdom like a contagion. After thirty days, the king finally realized that this was the curse of the blood pact, the price of infidelity. He apologized to the empire and pleaded with them to lift the curse. His plea was graciously accepted on the one hundredth day. By then, the king had lost half of his subordinates, as well as his lovely wife and child. That country remained under the control of the senate for a very long time.

flashback.speaker: Lekain
flashback.line: I hope I've made myself clear. No matter how you struggle, you have no choice but to follow the orders given to you by the empire. No matter how noble your motives, defiance against us will result in the death of your nation. This you must never forget. Ahhh, and one more thing... If you're considering seeking aid from outside of Daein, think again. We have spies and informants in every corner of Tellius. We will know immediately if you tell anyone.

battle.speaker: Tanith
battle.line: Blast! We're being ambushed! I should have known...

battle.speaker: Sigrun
battle.line: We're under attack. We will engage them now. Please stay inside the carriage, Your Majesty.

recruit-battle.speaker: Kieran
recruit-battle.line: Ugh... Aargh! We will pull back temporarily! I'm not fool enough to let my men die needlessly!

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: We're in position at the top of the cliff, and the Holy Guards are at the bottom. Just as we planned.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: All right. Thank you.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: There is no turning back now, Micaiah. You have to give the order.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Yes, I know.

end.speaker: Daein
end.line: General Maiel has fallen to the claws of the sub-humans! General Ike and the Laguz Alliance are heading this way to rescue the apostle!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: ...Prepare to move to the next phase. Archers, get ready! There's no more time for doubt.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: What are they doing? What are they pouring down the cliff?

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: No! It's... It's oil! They're going to set us aflame! Apostle, onto my pegasus! We'll take to the sky!

end.speaker: Tanith
end.line: We will protect the apostle from the archers by becoming her shield! Holy Guards, form up!

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: No! No, Sigrun! We cannot leave the others here! I will not allow it!

end.speaker: Tanith
end.line: Commander, we're ready!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Don't let the apostle escape! Archers, mages! Bring down that pegasus!

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: Don't move. I see one arrow fly, and the boy gets a quick lesson in falling.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Tibarn! Urk!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Sothe! No, please! All units, cease fire! Now!

end.speaker: Tauroneo
end.line: General Ike has reached us... We've failed.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Micaiah of Daein, listen to me very, very carefully.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Tell him to let Sothe go!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Not a chance. I'm offering you a choice. Surrender now and go home to Daein, or fight us and die.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: We can't. We won't retreat or negotiate. Regardless of what you believe, the only choice we have is to fight.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Micaiah, are you insane? Look around! Every single person in your army will die! Do you care that little about them?
Enough! Everyone stand down!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Apostle...

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: I've seen enough bloodshed for one day! That's enough! Please, no more...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: We'll retreat for now. You'd better do the same, and I mean now. I'm not sure how long I can hold my men back.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: But we can't!

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: Fine. His death is on your hands, then. Sorry, little Sothe, your friend just killed you. Say a quick good-bye.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: No, wait, Micai--!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: NOOO! SOTHE!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Oh, thank the goddess. Sothe...

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: Take this as a lesson, little beorc. Next time, there won't be anyone to catch you.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: General Tauroneo, I'll ask you one last time: talk some sense into that girl, all right? She's losing it.

end.speaker: Tauroneo
end.line: ...We won't pursue you this time. However, we cannot avoid this war. That is all I will say for now. And Ike...I'm sorry for this.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: What is going on with you people...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: What's the situation?

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: It's awful. The Begnion Central Army and the Crimean Royal Knights have almost been completely obliterated. On top of that, the oil that Daein used has injured the Holy Guards' pegasi and all but grounded them.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Yeah, I think awful fits. Thoughts, everyone?

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: Thoughts?! Daein must answer for this! We attack them immediately!

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: We can't. If we fought Daein now, we couldn't possibly take on the senate's armies. We have to get Daein to listen to us.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Confusion is exactly what Lekain wants. Daein is merely a pawn in his scheme. But there is one thing I do not understand. Why use such horrible tactics? Oil and fire? What is that girl Micaiah thinking?
Micaiah? The Imperial Army has Micaiah on their side?

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: Rafiel! When did you arrive?

end.speaker: Rafiel
end.line: Just now, with Reyson and Queen Nailah.

end.speaker: Nailah
end.line: Reyson went straight to his sister. He will be here with Leanne in a moment.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Is it all right for the three of you to be here? What about the medallion?

end.speaker: Rafiel
end.line: The medallion is right here.

end.speaker: Nailah
end.line: We're very near the point where galdrar won't be able to contain its power. If this war goes on much longer, the dark god will surely awaken.

end.speaker: Almedha
end.line: Please... Please save him. Please save my son. Come save my Pelleas, I beg of you...

end.speaker: Pelleas
end.line: I've found it! This is it! A way to break the blood pact! Thank the goddess... I will be able to save my people after all.

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: Prince Kurth? What are you doing out so late? Looking for something?

end.speaker: Kurthnaga
end.line: Oh, hello, Ena. No, I was just looking at the moon. Its reflection on the lake is quite lovely, isn't it?

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: Yes, quite.

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: You! H-how did you get in?! How did you find us?! Help, he's here!  Aaaargh!
My apologies for the long wait.
Is the apostle safe?
She fled to Crimea, then exposed the senate's plots to the world. Currently, she leads the apostle's army through Daein and is preparing to storm the empire.
I see. Very well... It's time for us to make our move.

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: As you wish, my master.

narration: Daein launches a surprise attack against the apostle's army, devastating her forces. It is all Apostle Sanaki can do to allay her remaining troops' burning desire for revenge. She knows that there is no hope of victory if her weakened forces are divided. However, she cannot move forward while danger follows at her back. This dilemma weighs heavily on the apostle's troops, crushing their morale.
Meanwhile, the Daein forces pull back to the fastness of Nox Castle. Micaiah, unable to explain her mission to her soldiers, keeps Daein's army together through sheer force of will.

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: I have to head back to the castle. I have to know if there is a way to break free of the blood pact.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Please be careful.

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: ...Please, Micaiah. Stop being so kind to me. It’s too difficult for me.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I can feel how you’ve suffered. You’ve had to endure it all alone for so long. It’s ghastly.

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: It was my fault... I brought this curse upon Daein!

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: No! You didn’t know! I will protect Daein. I’ll protect our country from harm, no matter what happens. You have my word.

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: Micaiah... Very well. I won’t give up. We’ll fight destiny together.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Yes.

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: I want you to take this. I found another one in the treasure room of the castle. Stand fast, Micaiah. I will find a way to save Daein.

conversation.speaker: Tauroneo
conversation.line: Sothe.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Hello, General.

conversation.speaker: Tauroneo
conversation.line: I thought you were going to leave the army, taking Lady Micaiah with you.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: I was. But now we can’t. Both Micaiah and I are from Daein. We can’t abandon our own country.

conversation.speaker: Tauroneo
conversation.line: Hmm. I wonder if it’s the same if you leave Daein...

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: I don’t understand.

conversation.speaker: Tauroneo
conversation.line: If you abandoned Daein and fought on the side of a different country, I wonder if you’d still be cursed?

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Who knows? I’m not a sage. In any case, it doesn’t matter. Micaiah would never leave Daein behind.

conversation.speaker: Tauroneo
conversation.line: I see. Sothe, here. Take these.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Why are you giving me these?

conversation.speaker: Tauroneo
conversation.line: I kept them as a parting gift to you. Since you’re staying, I’d like you to take them now.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: General...

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: These are all the funds we have for the near future. The problem now is stopping the apostle’s army from advancing.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Conventional tactics won’t slow them down. They’ll easily break through our lines. ...What should we do?

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Micaiah?

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Are you all right? I’ll leave the gold here. You’re still not completely recovered yet. You have to rest, Micaiah.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I’ll try.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Keep safe.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Nolan. Sorry to keep you waiting.

conversation.speaker: Nolan
conversation.line: Hmm? Hey, Sothe. Don’t worry. I was reading while I waited.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: I didn’t realize you were such a dedicated reader, Nolan.

conversation.speaker: Nolan
conversation.line: It’s human nature to crave knowledge. I thought you would know that as well as anyone. How is Micaiah, by the way? Is she doing well?

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Yeah, I believe so. She’s alert, and she seems generally stronger.

conversation.speaker: Nolan
conversation.line: I see. Well, that’s good, right?

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Sorry to make you worry.

conversation.speaker: Nolan
conversation.line: Don’t mention it.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: And...I...brought this for you.

conversation.speaker: Nolan
conversation.line: Hey, now! This is a good axe. Must have cost you a fair bit. Thanks.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Nolan, I...

conversation.speaker: Nolan
conversation.line: Don’t force it. You’ll only hurt yourself.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: What?

conversation.speaker: Nolan
conversation.line: You look like you’re carrying the weight of the world on your shoulders. You’re wondering if you should tell me, right?

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Right...

conversation.speaker: Nolan
conversation.line: The best thing to do is think it over. Give it some time to sit. Later, if you decide you want to tell me, you know exactly where to find me.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: I will. Thanks, Nolan.

conversation.speaker: Nolan
conversation.line: Anytime.
There she is! Hey, lady!

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Who? Oh, Nico!

conversation.speaker: Nico
conversation.line: This is great. I was hoping I’d find you.

conversation.speaker: Lady
conversation.line: Nico, mind your manners. The Silver-Haired Maiden is the saviour of Daein. She’s not just some "lady."

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Oh, it’s all right. I’m still the same simple girl from Daein you met before. Nothing’s changed. So, are things well with you?

conversation.speaker: Lady
conversation.line: Well, the fighting’s got everyone worried, coming so soon after the last war and all... But we’re doing all we can for Daein! It doesn’t matter who or what we’re up against. Believe me when I tell you we’ll never give up.

conversation.speaker: Nico
conversation.line: That’s right! We won’t give up. Ever! I know we’re gonna win, too. ‘Cause we’ve got you on our side. That’s what everybody says. The Dawn Brigade will save us.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Is that what they say? I see... Listen to me, Nico. You can believe in us. I promise we’ll keep you safe.

conversation.speaker: Nico
conversation.line: I knew it!

conversation.speaker: Lady
conversation.line: Come along, Nico. We should be going. The maiden’s got better things to do than stand here chatting with us all day.

conversation.speaker: Nico
conversation.line: Bye, lady! See you later!

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Yes...good-bye, Nico.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I... I want to save them all. The world is a better place with people like them in it.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: I know how you feel, Micaiah. That’s why we started all this. We’ve always been fighting for them. But this war we’re in... It’s not just. We’re fighting on the wrong side.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I know. I don’t want to see anyone die. It’s ironic... I’m killing with no malice, because I don’t want anyone to be killed. I... What am I supposed to do? Am I supposed to stand back and let all of Daein perish? Is that the "just" thing to do?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: If that’s what it takes to be just, then I want nothing to do with justice. I’d rather be hated and feared like Mad King Ashnard. I’d rather the dark god take my soul. I’m going to save my people, Sothe. If the rest of the world paints me as a beast to be reviled and hated, so be it.
